newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: PRESS DIGEST-Australian Sports News - May 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST-Australian Sports News - May 9.

text.p: (Compiled for Reuters by Media Monitors) -- THE AUSTRALIAN After vocal criticisms from New Zealand Rugby League officials, Super League has decided to send chairman Ken Cowley and executive director Ian Fryberg across the Tasman to curb the discontent. The alarm of possible problems came after NZRL chairman Davi Lange criticised Super league in a newspaper column, stating that the competition had not enhanced the game and that the teams in the Australian Rugby League were playing "better and harder football". Page 20. -- National Basketball League team the Melbourne Tigers is considering legal action after a decision to forfeit the Tigers April 25 win and give the points to the Adelaide 36ers was upheld by the NBL's Appeals Tribunal last night. The ruling came because theTigers played star centre Mark Bradke before he had an international clearance after playing for US team the Philadelphia 76ers.
